tests.name: Independent Samples t-Test
tests.description: Compares means of two independent groups to determine if they are statistically different.
assumptions: Equal variances (can be relaxed with Welch's t-test)
whenToUse: Sample size > 30 per group (or normally distributed)

tests.name: Paired Samples t-Test
tests.description: Compares means from the same group at two different times or under two different conditions.

tests.name: One-Way ANOVA
tests.description: Tests whether there are statistically significant differences between the means of three or more independent groups.

tests.name: Two-Way ANOVA
tests.description: Tests the effect of two independent categorical variables on a continuous outcome, including their interaction.

tests.name: Repeated Measures ANOVA
tests.description: Tests differences across multiple time points or conditions for the same subjects.

tests.name: Mann-Whitney U Test
tests.description: Non-parametric test that compares distributions of two independent groups.

tests.name: Wilcoxon Signed-Rank Test
tests.description: Non-parametric test for comparing two related samples or repeated measurements.

tests.name: Kruskal-Wallis H Test
tests.description: Non-parametric alternative to one-way ANOVA for comparing three or more independent groups.

tests.name: Friedman Test
tests.description: Non-parametric alternative to repeated measures ANOVA for ordinal or non-normal data.

tests.name: Pearson Correlation
tests.description: Measures the linear relationship between two continuous variables.

tests.name: Spearman Rank Correlation
tests.description: Non-parametric measure of monotonic relationship between two variables.

tests.name: Partial Correlation
tests.description: Measures association between two variables while controlling for one or more other variables.

tests.name: Linear Regression
tests.description: Models the relationship between a continuous outcome and one or more predictors.

tests.name: Multiple Linear Regression
tests.description: Models relationship between continuous outcome and multiple predictors simultaneously.

tests.name: Logistic Regression
tests.description: Models the probability of a binary outcome based on one or more predictors.

tests.name: Poisson Regression
tests.description: Models count data as a function of predictors, assuming counts follow a Poisson distribution.

tests.name: Ordinal Logistic Regression
tests.description: Models ordinal outcomes with three or more ordered categories.

tests.name: Chi-Square Test of Independence
tests.description: Tests whether there is a significant association between two categorical variables.
assumptions: Expected cell count >= 5 in 80% of cells

tests.name: Fisher's Exact Test
tests.description: Exact test for association in 2x2 contingency tables, especially with small samples.

tests.name: McNemar's Test
tests.description: Tests for differences in paired proportions or matched case-control studies.

tests.name: Linear Mixed Model
tests.description: Models continuous outcomes with both fixed and random effects for hierarchical/clustered data.

tests.name: Generalized Linear Mixed Model
tests.description: Extends GLM to include random effects for non-normal outcomes with clustering.

tests.name: ARIMA Model
tests.description: Autoregressive integrated moving average model for time series forecasting.

tests.name: Exponential Smoothing
tests.description: Weighted moving average methods for time series forecasting with trend and seasonality.

tests.name: Kaplan-Meier Estimator
tests.description: Non-parametric estimator of survival function from time-to-event data.

tests.name: Log-Rank Test
tests.description: Compares survival distributions between two or more groups.

tests.name: Cox Proportional Hazards
tests.description: Semi-parametric regression model for time-to-event data with covariates.

tests.name: K-Means Clustering
tests.description: Partitions observations into k clusters by minimizing within-cluster variance.

tests.name: Hierarchical Clustering
tests.description: Builds a tree of clusters using agglomerative or divisive approaches.

tests.name: Principal Component Analysis
tests.description: Reduces dimensionality by finding orthogonal directions of maximum variance.

tests.name: Factor Analysis
tests.description: Identifies latent factors underlying observed variables.

tests.name: Random Forest
tests.description: Ensemble of decision trees for classification or regression with improved accuracy.

tests.name: Gradient Boosting
tests.description: Sequentially builds weak learners to minimize prediction errors.

tests.name: Lasso/Ridge Regression
tests.description: Regularized regression methods that shrink coefficients to prevent overfitting.

tests.name: Bootstrap
tests.description: Resampling method to estimate sampling distributions and confidence intervals.

tests.name: Permutation Test
tests.description: Non-parametric test using random permutations to generate null distribution.

tests.name: Power Analysis
tests.description: Calculates required sample size or statistical power for detecting an effect.

tests.name: Levene's Test
tests.description: Tests the null hypothesis that all groups have equal variances. More robust to non-normality than Bartlett's test.
whenToUse: Checking homogeneity of variance before ANOVA

tests.name: Bartlett's Test
tests.description: Tests equality of variances across groups, sensitive to departures from normality.

tests.name: Brown-Forsythe Test
tests.description: Robust test for equality of variances using deviations from group medians.

tests.name: Fligner-Killeen Test
tests.description: Non-parametric test for homogeneity of variances, highly robust to non-normality.

tests.name: Hartley's F-max Test
tests.description: Quick test for variance homogeneity using ratio of largest to smallest group variance.

tests.name: Shapiro-Wilk Test
tests.description: Tests whether a sample comes from a normally distributed population. Considered one of the most powerful normality tests.

tests.name: Kolmogorov-Smirnov Test
tests.description: Compares sample distribution to a reference distribution (often normal) or compares two samples.

tests.name: Anderson-Darling Test
tests.description: Tests whether a sample comes from a specified distribution, with more weight on tails than KS test.

tests.name: D'Agostino-Pearson Test
tests.description: Omnibus test combining skewness and kurtosis to test for normality.

tests.name: Durbin-Watson Test
tests.description: Tests for autocorrelation in residuals from regression analysis.

tests.name: Breusch-Pagan Test
tests.description: Tests for heteroscedasticity in regression residuals.

tests.name: Variance Inflation Factor (VIF)
tests.description: Quantifies multicollinearity in regression by measuring how much variance is inflated.

tests.name: Tukey's HSD
tests.description: Post-hoc test for pairwise comparisons after ANOVA, controlling family-wise error rate.

tests.name: Bonferroni Correction
tests.description: Simple adjustment for multiple comparisons by dividing alpha by number of tests.

tests.name: Holm-Bonferroni Method
tests.description: Step-down procedure that is uniformly more powerful than Bonferroni while controlling FWER.

tests.name: Benjamini-Hochberg (FDR)
tests.description: Controls false discovery rate rather than family-wise error rate, more powerful for many tests.

tests.name: Dunnett's Test
tests.description: Compares multiple treatment groups to a single control group.

tests.name: Games-Howell Test
tests.description: Post-hoc test for unequal variances and/or unequal sample sizes.

tests.name: Scheff√©'s Test
tests.description: Most conservative post-hoc test, allows any linear contrast of means.

tests.name: Dunn's Test
tests.description: Non-parametric post-hoc test for pairwise comparisons after Kruskal-Wallis.

tests.name: Welch's t-Test
tests.description: Modification of t-test that does not assume equal variances between groups.

tests.name: Welch's ANOVA
tests.description: Robust alternative to one-way ANOVA when variances are unequal across groups.

tests.name: ANCOVA
tests.description: Analysis of covariance combining ANOVA with regression to control for covariates.

tests.name: MANOVA
tests.description: Multivariate ANOVA testing group differences on multiple dependent variables simultaneously.

tests.name: Kendall's Tau
tests.description: Non-parametric measure of rank correlation, more robust than Spearman for small samples.

tests.name: Point-Biserial Correlation
tests.description: Measures correlation between a continuous variable and a dichotomous variable.

tests.name: Intraclass Correlation (ICC)
tests.description: Measures reliability or agreement for observations that are organized into groups.

tests.name: Cochran's Q Test
tests.description: Extension of McNemar test for comparing three or more matched proportions.

tests.name: Cram√©r's V
tests.description: Measure of association between two categorical variables, normalized chi-square.

tests.name: Cohen's Kappa
tests.description: Measures agreement between two raters for categorical items, adjusting for chance.

tests.name: Fleiss' Kappa
tests.description: Extends Cohen's kappa to measure agreement among three or more raters.

tests.name: Negative Binomial Regression
tests.description: Models count data with overdispersion (variance greater than mean).

tests.name: Zero-Inflated Poisson
tests.description: Models count data with excess zeros using a two-part model.

tests.name: Quantile Regression
tests.description: Models conditional quantiles (e.g., median) rather than the mean.

tests.name: Robust Regression
tests.description: Regression methods resistant to outliers and violations of assumptions.

tests.name: Probit Regression
tests.description: Models binary outcomes using the cumulative normal distribution function.

tests.name: Support Vector Machine (SVM)
tests.description: Finds optimal hyperplane to separate classes, can use kernels for non-linear boundaries.

tests.name: XGBoost
tests.description: Optimized gradient boosting library with regularization and parallel processing.

tests.name: LightGBM
tests.description: Gradient boosting framework using leaf-wise tree growth for faster training.

tests.name: CatBoost
tests.description: Gradient boosting with native categorical feature support and ordered boosting.

tests.name: k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN)
tests.description: Classifies or predicts based on the k closest training examples in feature space.

tests.name: Naive Bayes
tests.description: Probabilistic classifier based on Bayes' theorem with independence assumption.

tests.name: Decision Tree
tests.description: Tree-structured model making sequential splits based on feature values.

tests.name: Elastic Net
tests.description: Regularized regression combining L1 (Lasso) and L2 (Ridge) penalties.

tests.name: Neural Network (MLP)
tests.description: Multi-layer perceptron with hidden layers for learning complex patterns.

tests.name: DBSCAN
tests.description: Density-based clustering that finds arbitrarily shaped clusters and identifies outliers.

tests.name: Gaussian Mixture Model
tests.description: Probabilistic model assuming data comes from a mixture of Gaussian distributions.
assumptions: Known or estimated number of components

tests.name: t-SNE
tests.description: Non-linear dimensionality reduction technique for visualization of high-dimensional data.

tests.name: UMAP
tests.description: Uniform Manifold Approximation for fast non-linear dimension reduction preserving global structure.

tests.name: Prophet
tests.description: Automated forecasting procedure by Facebook for time series with seasonality and holidays.

tests.name: Augmented Dickey-Fuller Test
tests.description: Tests for unit root to determine if a time series is stationary.

tests.name: Granger Causality Test
tests.description: Tests whether one time series helps predict another (temporal precedence).

tests.name: Ljung-Box Test
tests.description: Tests whether any autocorrelations in a series are non-zero.

tests.name: Vector Autoregression (VAR)
tests.description: Models multiple time series where each variable depends on its own and others' past values.

tests.name: Bayesian t-Test
tests.description: Bayesian alternative to t-test providing posterior probability of hypotheses.

tests.name: Bayesian Regression
tests.description: Regression with prior distributions on parameters, yielding posterior distributions.

tests.name: Bayesian ANOVA
tests.description: Bayesian approach to comparing group means with Bayes factors.

tests.name: Accelerated Failure Time Model
tests.description: Parametric survival model where covariates accelerate or decelerate time to event.

tests.name: Competing Risks Analysis
tests.description: Analyzes time-to-event when multiple event types can occur, only one observed.

tests.name: Random Survival Forest
tests.description: Extension of random forest to survival data with censoring.

tests.name: Cohen's d
tests.description: Standardized measure of effect size for difference between two means.

tests.name: Hedges' g
tests.description: Bias-corrected version of Cohen's d for small sample sizes.

tests.name: Eta-squared / Partial Eta-squared
tests.description: Proportion of variance explained by a factor in ANOVA designs.

tests.name: Odds Ratio
tests.description: Ratio of odds of an event occurring in one group vs another.
